channel.title: What do you use?
channel.description: Well I recently had to flush out my computer and am looking to get some new tools now after I set up my router. So I was wondering what coding assistant tools do you guys use? I'm looking to get a few instead of relying on just one like I did before. Recommendations?

item.title: What do you use?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote="_s, post:37, topic:424122"][quote author=t4 link=topic=526778.msg3845391#msg3845391 date=1323570179]

ITT: People who think they’re cool because they use a text editor to write code (most likely linuxfags as well).

no i use rocks and chisels to write my code m8

basic in a nutshell

since when is BASIC an editor or IDE?
[/quote]i think he means it’s nothing but rocks and chisels, and if so i disagree… that’s assembly[/quote]

no i mean i rather hit myself in the head with a rock then use basic, the chisels are just there for decoration

Read full topic

item.title: What do you use?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:28, topic:424122”]Yes, I use both Eclipse and NotePad. I was waiting for what he said to provoke you to reply. I’m not sure we understand each other very well, lol.[/quote]well he’s bound to step on someone’s nerves with a blatant and dumb provocation like that. i use vim because i like it, i’m familiar with it and i’m efficient with it, not because it’s cool. come to think, when would a clone of a text editor that came out decades ago ever be considered cool anyway…

Read full topic

item.title: What do you use?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Yes, I use both Eclipse and NotePad. I was waiting for what he said to provoke you to reply. I’m not sure we understand each other very well, lol.

item.title: What do you use?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:24, topic:424122”]ITT: People who think they’re cool because they use a text editor to write code (most likely linuxfags as well).[/quote]IDEs are glorified text editors with gradual learning curves and prepackaged specialised features/automation tools. i don’t see your point.

[quote=“The Outsider, post:25, topic:424122”][quote author=The Enforcer link=topic=526778.msg3843536#msg3843536 date=1323452404]
ITT: People who think they’re cool because they use a text editor to write code (most likely linuxfags as well).
[/quote]
That will step on some nerves… wait for it…[/quote]apart from the fact that thousands if not hundreds of thousands, perhaps even millions of programmers use programs regarded as text editors to write code. any scriptable text editor can be as powerful as any ide, a power-user’s specialised tarted up emacs and/or vim setups have proven this point countless times.

Read full topic
